intro: Conostylis latens, commonly known as the slender conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their striking floral displays. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. Its flowers are usually red or orange, with narrow, strap-like petals that are characteristic of the genus. Conostylis latens is often found in coastal and inland regions, adapting well to dry and nutrient-poor environments.
